I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

st2: state
st1: state

P <sc Q -> in_code (fst st1) P -> Q // st1 :1> st2 -> P // st1 :1> st2

in_sss_step : forall (k : nat) (l : list instr) (i : instr) (r : list instr) (st1 st2 : state), fst st1 = k + length l -> st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2 -> (k, l ++ i :: r) // st1 :1> st2
sss_step_fun : forall (P : code) (s t1 t2 : state), P // s :1> t1 -> P // s :1> t2 -> t1 = t2
sss_step = fun (P : code) (st1 st2 : state) => exists (k : nat) (l : list instr) (i : instr) (r : list instr) (d : data), P = (k, l ++ i :: r) /\ st1 = (k + length l, d) /\ st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2 : code -> state -> state -> Prop

sss_step_subcode_inv : forall (P : code) (ii : instr) (st st' : state), (fst st, ii :: nil) <sc P -> P // st :1> st' -> st ⟬ ii ⦒ st'
sss_step_in_code : forall (P : code) (st1 st2 : state), P // st1 :1> st2 -> in_code (fst st1) P
sss_step_supcode : forall (P : subcode.code instr) (Q : code) (st st' : state), P <sc Q -> in_code (fst st) P -> Q // st :1> st' -> P // st :1> st'

subcode_sss_progress : forall (P : subcode.code instr) (Q : code) (st1 st2 : state), P <sc Q -> P // st1 -+> st2 -> Q // st1 -+> st2

subcode_sss_compute_linstr : forall (k : nat) (li : list instr) (P : code) (st1 st2 st : state), (fst st1, li)//st1-[k] -> st2 -> (fst st1, li) <sc P -> P // st2 -> > st -> P // st1 -> > st
sss_step_dec : forall (P : code) (st1 st2 : state), {P // st1 :1> st2} + {~ P // st1 :1> st2}
sss_steps_sind : forall (P : code) (P0 : nat -> state -> state -> SProp), (forall st : state, P0 0 st st) -> (forall (n : nat) (st1 st2 st3 : state), P // st1 :1> st2 -> P//st2-[n]->st3 -> P0 n st2 st3 -> P0 (S n) st1 st3) -> forall (n : nat) (p p0 : state), P//p-[n] -> p0 -> P0 n p p0
sss_steps_ind : forall (P : code) (P0 : nat -> state -> state -> Prop), (forall st : state, P0 0 st st) -> (forall (n : nat) (st1 st2 st3 : state), P // st1 :1> st2 -> P//st2-[n]->st3 -> P0 n st2 st3 -> P0 (S n) st1 st3) -> forall (n : nat) (p p0 : state), P//p-[n] -> p0 -> P0 n p p0
subcode_in_code : forall (X : Type) (P : subcode.code X) (Q : nat * list X) (i : nat), P <sc Q -> in_code i P -> in_code i Q
Inductive sss_steps (P : code) : nat -> state -> state -> Prop := in_sss_steps_0 : forall st : state, P//st-[0] -> st | in_sss_steps_S : forall (n : nat) (st1 st2 st3 : state), P // st1 :1> st2 -> P//st2-[n] -> st3 -> P//st1-[S n] -> st3 Arguments sss_steps _ _%nat_scope Arguments in_sss_steps_S [P] [n]%nat_scope [st1 st2 st3]
sss_steps_1 : forall (P : code) (st1 st2 : state), P // st1 :1> st2 -> P//st1-[1] -> st2
in_sss_steps_S : forall (P : code) (n : nat) (st1 st2 st3 : state), P // st1 :1> st2 -> P//st2-[n] -> st3 -> P//st1-[S n] -> st3
sss_compute_trans : forall (P : code) (st1 st2 st3 : state), P // st1 -> > st2 -> P // st2 -> > st3 -> P // st1 -> > st3
subcode_out_code : forall (X : Type) (P : subcode.code X) (Q : nat * list X) (i : nat), P <sc Q -> out_code i Q -> out_code i P

```  
intros. unfold P. intros. intros. intros. intros. intros. intros. intros. intros. intros. intros. intros. intros. intros. intros. 
intros. intros. apply subcode_sss_step in H4. apply sss_fun with (i:=Q) in H6. apply sss_step_subcode_inv with (P:=Q) in H4. apply sss_step_fun with (P:=Q) in H6. apply sss_step_fun with (P:=P) in H5. rewrite <- H6. rewrite <- H5. auto.
```

original: intros. unfold P. intros. intros. intros. intros. intros. intros. intros. intros. intros. intros. intros. intros. intros. intros. intros. intros. apply subcode_sss_step in H4. apply sss_fun with (i:=Q) in H6. apply sss_step_subcode_inv with (P:=Q) in H4. apply sss_step_fun with (P:=Q) in H6. apply sss_step_fun with (P:=P) in H5. rewrite <- H6. rewrite <- H5. auto.
